timeline.message: 6865 fix alternate filter use for domains

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we should run the CR for every query.
timeline.author: dannysmyda

replies.bodyText: With your solution below this will be removed.
replies.author: wschaeferB

timeline.bodyText: I think the mistake here on my part was not adding attributes to results before running the filters. So, I think this block of code should be moved before the filters are applied. That way, only the frequency attribute will run when it's selected.
timeline.author: dannysmyda

replies.bodyText: Definitely a better solution thank you, I just tossed in what I was doing for files and should of spent more time and figured out out how to re-arrange the code.
replies.author: wschaeferB

timeline.bodyText: I think this should stay, so that if only the frequency filter is selected it'll work.
timeline.author: dannysmyda

replies.bodyText: With your above change of re-ordering code yes it will be necessary to keep this.
replies.author: wschaeferB

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't you need to do this https://github.com/sleuthkit/autopsy/blob/develop/Core/src/org/sleuthkit/autopsy/discovery/search/DomainSearchCacheLoader.java#L73, before applying filters? Also just for grouping in general if the selected attribute needs it.
timeline.author: dannysmyda

replies.bodyText:
We are currently adding the grouping and sorting attributes right before we group and sort in FileSearch.runFileSearch so my comment was very misleading by mentioning that it could also be used by grouping and sorting.
I can pass along the additional arguments for grouping and sorting to this SearchFiltering.runQueries and then to this method getResultList and move the adding of grouping and sorting attributes into this method to re-order in a similar fashion to your fix for the Domain Search.
Thank you.
replies.author: wschaeferB

replies.bodyText: Or wait need to think about this, I can't remember what moving it will get me.
replies.author: wschaeferB

replies.bodyText: Yeah didn't need to be moved apparently not initializing the frequency variable to unknown for file results was basically the entire problem with file based other occurrences.
replies.author: wschaeferB

timeline.bodyText: This is important for not re-calculating frequencies. I think it should stay.
timeline.author: dannysmyda

replies.bodyText: This check was moved earlier to line 262 as a conditional just inside the for the loop wrapping everything so that frequencies won't be recalculated for files either.
replies.author: wschaeferB

timeline.message: 6865 changes to address feedback and help performance

timeline.bodyText: There was a thread interrupt check here that got removed with the merge conflict.
timeline.author: dannysmyda

timeline.message: 6865 add back interrupted check after bad merge conflict resolution

timeline.author: dannysmyda

replies.bodyText:
it appears this happened at the same time as the deleted conditional, and all revolves around me botching that merge conflict resolution.
Will fix, thank you for catching, apologies for the headache.
replies.author: wschaeferB
